abstract: The performer ‘Weird Al’ Yankovic sues Sony for $5 million in unpaid royalties and money from the music industry’s deal with Google. Also, songwriters in Britain now make more money from digital music than in pubs.
snippet: The performer ‘Weird Al’ Yankovic sues Sony for $5 million in unpaid royalties and money from the music industry’s deal with Google. Also, songwriters in Britain now make more money from digital music than in pubs.
lead_paragraph: Adding to the recent wave of artists suing record companies over online royalties, “Weird Al” Yankovic has sued Sony Music Entertainment, saying he is owed more than $5 million. In the suit, filed Friday at United States District Court in Manhattan, Mr. Yankovic says the company underpaid him for videos and other expenses, and also incorrectly counted downloads of his music as “sales” rather than as “licenses,” which pay a higher royalty rate.

headline.main: Digital Notes: ‘Weird Al’ Yankovic Sues Sony for $5 million
